results.title: The Anatomy of a group
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Illustrates the structure of a group, the goals to be achieved during meetings, participation patterns, the quality of communication, group standards, and group procedures. Discusses the difference between a collection of individuals and a group, and the means of getting a new group off to a good start.

results.title: Sharing the Leadership
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Explores three categories of individual action and their relation to group leadership: self-serving functions, task functions and group serving functions.

results.title: Drugs and the very young
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The fourth film in the series suggests reasons why teenagers may begin to experiment with drugs. Using simulated everyday situations shows how children learn from example that drugs can bring pleasure and relief. Finally an expert outlines a program which presents real alternatives.

results.title: The Allure of drugs
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
This film examines the conflicting attitudes to drugs throughout history. Considers the introduction of coffee and tobacco, prohibition of alcohol and use of drugs in ancient cultures. Points out that periods of change often accompany the introduction of new drugs.

results.title: Drugs in our time
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The first film in the series looks at the socioeconomic setting of drug abuse. Seeks reasons for rising use of drugs among young people, and concludes that children are making choices and it is up to adults to prepare them for this.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)

results.title: What some communities are doing
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The sixth film in the series describes two broadly based educational efforts to deal with the problem of youthful drug abuse: (1) designed by a school district; and (2) a community effort by some affluent suburbs. Emphasises the need for a total community commitment and planning.

results.title: What can we do?
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The final films in the series looks at three different approaches to communication between adults and young people as they attempt to make decisions about life and drug. Includes scenes with pre-teens, teenagers, and college students. Urges all avenues of communication to be opened. From the series: Drugs: the children are choosing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)

results.title: The Pharmacology of drugs
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The third film in the series presents a systematic discussion of drugs and their effects. Examines all classes of drugs, then urges that drug abuse education focus on the dangers of alcohol and cigarettes with an emphasis equal to that placed on other drugs. With Dr James Fadiman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
